content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code to clean a column name in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\s+", "_")
end
```
This function takes a string as input (a column name), and returns a new string that has been lowercased, stripped of any leading or trailing whitespaces, and any spaces and hyphens have been replaced with underscores.

Here is an example usage:
```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```
